str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
Earth, soil, dust. From the base of cheimon; a heap, i.e. Rubbish; loose dirt.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To mourn, lament, feel guilt. From penthos; to grieve.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.
Woe!, alas!, uttered in grief or denunciation. A primary exclamation of grief; 'woe'.
Woe!, alas!, uttered in grief or denunciation. A primary exclamation of grief; 'woe'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To become rich, be rich, abound in. From ploutizo; to be wealthy.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Preciousness, costliness, worth. From timios; expensiveness, i.e. magnificence.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
Apparently a primary word; an 'hour'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make desolate, bring to desolation, destroy, waste, (b) of a person: I strip, rob. From eremos; to lay waste.
